subject: Science
title: The Richter Scale and Beyond
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Richter Scale and Beyond.

hook.text: When an earthquake hits, the first question is always: how big was it?

buildup.text: Charles Richter invented his scale in 1935 to measure earthquake magnitude.

discovery.text: The scale is logarithmic â€” each whole number is 10 times more ground motion.

twist.text: A magnitude 9 releases 31,000 times more energy than a magnitude 6.

climax.text: Today scientists use the moment magnitude scale, but still call it 'Richter' in media.

punchline.text: Going from 6 to 9 sounds small. It's 31,000 times more energy.

quiz.question: What does the earthquake magnitude scale measure logarithmically?
